result.execSummary:
The defendant Deion Kentrell White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court is not opposed to defendant being in the Dosage Program Program if he qualifies.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments while on probation or serve 10 days in HOC, consecutive.  bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.   To make regular monthly payments.

Enroll in a GED or HSED program.  Seek and maintain employment,  at least part time employment if actively going to school.  Participate in an employment referral program or job training program as referred by agent.

Provide a DNA sample to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Court advised defendant:  that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No alcohol.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No association with known drug users or dealers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Complete a parenting class.
Complete a domestic violence course if agent deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees, to make regular monthly payments.

AODA assessment and satisfactorily completion of any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month randomly.

timeConds.notes:
Consecutive.  STAYED, to be used by the agent for any violations: to serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second, and balance for the third.
**5/15/2015  Commitment issued.  Stay lifted as to 60 days.  Straight time.  No good time credit.  Starting 3/27/15.

For commitment for condition time for non-compliance with probation conditions.  Order signed on 5/15/2015, and filed on todays date.  Defendant shall spend 60 days  straight time, with no good time credit, starting, 3/27/2015.  Copy sent to parties.  aw
Revised memo, received and filed.  aw

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to JUDGE FIORENZA
for review.OS

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ X ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Deion Kentrell White in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Deion Kentrell White in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered COUNT 2, dismissed and read in.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  Court gives credit for 0 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
Court is not opposed to defendant being in the Dosage Probation program if he qualifies.

- 12 MONTHS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and balance for the third violation.
- AODA assessment andsatisfactorily completion of any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- Enroll in a GED or HSED program.
- Seek and maintain employment, at least part time employment if actively going to school.
- Participate in an employment referral program or job training program as referred by agent.
- Complete a parenting class.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Complete a domestic violence course if agent deemed appropriate.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/22/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deion Kentrell White in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs for Jeffrey Schwarz.  Defendant Deion Kentrell White in custody.  Paul Hauer for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Christopher Schlachter-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of the address of "3575 North 11th Street" as to COUNTS 1 AND 2 on page 1.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
